elements.title: Turkish Airlines Flight 301 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Turkish prime minister Bülent Ecevit's first order in office was to send the minister of transport to the crash site of Turkish Airlines Flight 301 (aircraft pictured)?

elements.title: Assembly Rooms (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Assembly Rooms in Belfast, which housed a branch of the Belfast Banking Company for more than 100 years, were the venue for the court-martial of leaders of the Irish Rebellion of 1798?

elements.title: Emma Dean Powell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Emma Dean Powell received a pass from General Ulysses S. Grant to accompany her husband to battlefield camps during the American Civil War after he lost his arm?

elements.title: Eocene Okanagan Highlands (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Eocene Okanagan Highlands span approximately 1,000 km (620 mi) through British Columbia and Washington?

elements.title: Mihi Edwards (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Mihi Edwards did not use her own name as a young woman because of discrimination against Māori people in New Zealand?

elements.title: International Building (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1933, the groundbreaking ceremony for the Italian wing of Rockefeller Center's International Building was interrupted by a fascist chant led by an unemployed bricklayer?

elements.title: Shin-chan: Me and the Professor on Summer Vacation (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sacco Saito, who arranged and performed the theme song for Shin-chan: Me and the Professor on Summer Vacation, was not told the content of the game until after the song had been recorded?

elements.title: Bumper Pool (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bumper Pool legally changed his name to Bumper when he was 16 because of his father's childhood love for bumper pool?
